intro: Auriculardisia squamata, commonly known as the squamate auriculate plant, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive auriculate (ear-shaped) leaf bases and densely hairy foliage. Native to tropical regions, this plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough, scaly texture. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes.
